name: Mata N'ativa Pousada

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: With respect to the pousada, we enjoyed very much our stay. The place is calm, beautiful, confortable and perfectly integrated into the surrounding forest. The staff is courteous and efficient; they made us feel at home all the time. Breakfast is delicious and enough to let us spend the whole day on they beach without lunch. Although there is a lot of mosquitos, ants and other insects around, we could easily sleep without any incident. I would not go there without protection though, specially if one is alergic to insect bites. We stayed at "Jequitiba" room and it was perfect for a couple, with a nice jacuzzi. We have not visited the other rooms but they seemed smaller.
reviews.title: Great location

likes.disliked: — The absence of a room service or restaurant.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed February 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Trancoso is the pefect spot for those that want to enjoy the calm, warm waters of southern Bahia and still be close to civilization. Personally I think that the neighborhood has become a bit too posh in the last years and, as a consequence, it lost a bit of its soul. But still, the tranquility, the sightseeing and the long, almost deserted beaches are worth the visit. It is a better choice than Porto Seguro, which has become too crowded after big tour operators have taken the city by assault.
reviews.title: Oasis offering luxury, style and comfort in perfect balance with nature

likes.liked: — Privacy within the pousada grounds, yet closness to beach and quadrado. Perfect service.
likes.disliked: — That we ran out of time !!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Pousada Mata N'ativa is located about 5 minutes walk from the beach and 5 minutes from the "Quadrado". For us, this was convenient since we prefer to be close to the beach than to the buzzle of bars and restaurants. The only inconvenience was that we had to walk uphill every night in order to eat something, since the pousada serves only breakfast and some sandwiches at night. Besides being a steep uphill, the path to Quadrado was really dark and a bit scary at night. The locals say that there is no danger but we witnessed a robery one night and once we had to change our places on the beach because of a couple of suspicious guys that insisted on staring at us. I was born and raised in Brazil and my wife has been there many times so we don't tend to be scared without reason; my advise is, relax and enjoy but be aware that your spending might be worth a year's salary of a local family.
reviews.title: Really, really lovely Pousada

reviews.text: After spending some time reviewing the options of staying either in the quadrado OR by the beach, we found Mata N'ativa. After speaking with the owners Daniel and Danella (both with excellent command of English) we were glad to hear the pousada was positioned ideally between both !
reviews.title: Like a dream

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Mata N'ativa is not as expensive as some of the other pousada's in Trancoso, so i had adjusted my expectations - incorrectly.
reviews.title: Small paradies in paradies

likes.liked: — Pretty Location, very well kept, very attentive owners

description: Mata N´ativa Pousada is an ecolodge of charm very well located walking distance to the village center and to the beach. It was created in an environmental-friendly concept respecting the existing trees, the local ecosystem and wild live. The owners succeeded in developing this small hotel where you feel overwhelmed by nature. Triage of products, recycling, solar panels and energy system control, are part of our initiatives to lessen our impact on nature. Charming ambiances and attention to details are also key elements. The owners always around will welcome you in person. We organize trips in kayaks, bicycles, horseback ridings, etc.
